message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NI

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses the overflow problem in network coding and proposes a new scheme to improve the performance of a cloud storage system. Information theory is closely related to network coding and storage systems, making this category the most likely fit.
2. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - The proposed scheme is a network coding based secure storage (NCSS) scheme that considers security requirements in encoding procedures and distributed architectures. This makes it relevant to the cryptography and security category.
3. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper discusses distributed architectures and proposes a scheme to improve the performance of a cloud storage system. This makes it relevant to the distributed computing category.
4. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper proposes a new scheme to improve the performance of a cloud storage system, which involves designing efficient data structures and algorithms. This makes it relevant to the data structures and algorithms category.
5. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper discusses network coding and proposes a new scheme to improve the performance of a cloud storage system. This makes it relevant to the networking and internet architecture category.
